title: MacBook Pro Retina Mid 2015 820-00138-A RAM beeping
message: In the past I did a reflow to the RAM chips on a MacBook Air, it worked but it came back after about 2 weeks, should I try the same here or what is the standard procedure?

title: MacBook Pro Retina Mid 2015 820-00138-A RAM beeping
message:
Whats the history of the machine ? Liquid damage ? its very uncommon to have that on the 2015 15 inch :: Tha MacBook Air you did a reflow I suppose was a 2011, which was most likely the PCH  and the reason why it came back .. Please confirm you have 1.5V Supply for the RAM 

[IMG]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/core/blob:https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/54160494-053a-494f-92b2-7640ffd67b79[/IMG]

title: MacBook Pro Retina Mid 2015 820-00138-A RAM beeping
message: Check for voltage to RAM as mentioned. If voltage is present, reflow RAM and pray. If RAM doesn't fix it, bad CPU, bad internal trace etc and waste of time.

title: MacBook Pro Retina Mid 2015 820-00138-A RAM beeping
message:
No liquid damage, looks clean, when I first turned it on it did boot but shortly after it started beeping and that is why the customer brought it in.

Yes the other Air was a 2011 model one.

RAM voltage was there, so I went for the reflow, now the machine does not turn on, all power rails are there, not sure why it is not starting up.

title: MacBook Pro Retina Mid 2015 820-00138-A RAM beeping
message:
The heat applied on the board affected CPU, or PCH.
Even some broken trace, which made intermitently contact before.
This is hopeless project...

title: MacBook Pro Retina Mid 2015 820-00138-A RAM beeping
message: Thanks, learned a lot from this one rare issue.
